schema.title: SeismicTraceDataWorkProductComponent
schema.description: A single logical dataset containing seismic samples.

ResourceTypeID.description: The SRN of the resource's resource type.

ResourceID.description: The SRN which identifies this SDU resource object at the version level.

ResourceHomeRegionID.description: The name of the home [cloud environment] region for this SDU resource object.

ResourceHostRegionIDs.description: The name of the host [cloud environment] region(s) for this SDU resource object.

ResourceObjectCreationDateTime.description: Timestamp of the time at which Version 1 of this SDU resource object was originated.

ResourceVersionCreationDateTime.description: Timestamp of the time when the current version of this resource entered the SDU.

ResourceCurationStatus.description: Describes the current Curation status. Possible values - CREATED, CURATING, CURATED.

ResourceLifecycleStatus.description: Describes the current Resource Lifecycle status. Possible values - LOADING, RECIEVED, ACCEPTED, RESCINDED, DELETED

ResourceSecurityClassification.description: Classifies the security level of the resourcse. Possible values = RESTRICTED, CLASSIFIED, CONFIDENTIAL, MOST-CONFIDENTIAL

LiveTraceOutline.description: Polygon showing the coverage of live traces in the trace dataset

BinGridID.description: Reference to the WPC which describes the node positions of the processed bin centers.

PrincipalAcquisitionProjectID.description: For most datasets, the acquisition project that generated the underlying field data.  For merges, probably absent (see processing project for set of acquisition projects used in processing this dataset).

ProcessingProjectID.description: The processing project from which this trace dataset was produced.  Absent for field data.

PreferredInterpretationProjectID.description: SRN of the Interpretation Project which can be considered the master for the area and of which this trace dataset is a privileged member.  It defines the set of trace datasets of a particular bin grid that form the best set for interpretation.

SeismicTraceDataDimensionalityTypeID.description: The dimensionality of trace data sets (not as acquired but as in the dataset), such as 2D, 3D, 4D.

SeismicDomainTypeID.description: ID of the nature of the vertical axis in the trace data set, usually Depth or Time.

Seismic2DName.description: 2D line name or survey name for the 2D group

GeoContext.description: List of area names which provide geographic context to the WPC.  This may include multiple types or multiple values of the same type.

GeoPoliticalEntityTypeID.description: The kind of area such as Country or Block, duplicated here from GeoPoliticalEntity object for application convenience.

SeismicMigrationTypeID.description: ID of the Seismic Migration Data Type

SeismicStackingTypeID.description: ID of the Seismic Stacking Type

SeismicAttributeTypeID.description: ID of the Seismic Trace Data Type

SeismicFilteringTypeID.description: ID of the Seismic Filtering Type

Phase.description: Amount of phase rotation applied to data

Polarity.description: Reflection polarity of embedded wavelet.  Normal, Reverse, Plus 90, Minus 90 according to SEG standard.

SeismicProcessingStageTypeID.description: It specifies if the seismic is as acquired, or has been manipulated by a process or workflow before arriving at its current state.

SampleCount.description: Number of samples in the vertical direction.

Difference.description: Indicates if the volume is a product of the difference between 4D surveys

StartTime.description: The sample axis value in the vertical dimension at which Time formatted data starts. Use seismicdomaintype to know which of time or depth pairs is the actual range vs. what is estimated.

EndTime.description: The sample axis value in the vertical dimension at which Time formatted data starts. Use seismicdomaintype to know which of time or depth pairs is the actual range vs. what is estimated.

StartDepth.description: The sample axis value in the vertical dimension at which Depth formatted data starts. Use seismicdomaintype to know which of time or depth pairs is the actual range vs. what is estimated.

EndDepth.description: The sample axis value in the vertical dimension at which Depth formatted data ends. Use seismicdomaintype to know which of time or depth pairs is the actual range vs. what is estimated.

TraceCount.description: How many traces are in the volume

TraceLength.description: Maximum trace length calculated using depth or time start and end points as appropriate according to seismicdomaintype.

TraceDomainUOM.description: UOM for vertical trace domain values

FirstShotPoint.description: The shotpoint that came before all others

LastShotPoint.description: The last shotpoint represented by the data

InlineIncrement.description: Sampling interval of inlines in this dataset (difference in labels between neighboring inlines).

CrosslineIncrement.description: Sampling interval of crosslines in this dataset (difference in labels between neighboring crosslines).

VerticalDatumOffset.description: Datum value, the elevation of zero time/depth on the vertical axis in the domain of seismicdomaintype relative to the vertical reference datum used (usually MSL). Positive is upward from zero elevation to seismic datum).

VerticalDatumUOM.description: Unit of measure for vertical datum

VerticalMeasurementTypeID.description: Identifies a vertical reference datum type. E.g. mean sea level, ground level, mudline.

ReplacementVelocity.description: Value used to produce vertical static shifts in data

ShiftApplied.description: Indicates how much the data has been shifted from the Vertical Datum (seismic reference datum) in the domain and units of seismicdomaintype and in the sense that a positive number causes a sample to move downward in physical space (lower elevation).

Precision.description: Data format in terms of sample value precision 8bit Integer, 16bit Floating Point etc

ProcessingParameters.description: Processing Parameters to simply capture process history until full provenance model can be implemented.

ProcessingParameterValue.description: The quantity for the processing parameter. May include units, ordering, and other descriptions.

SEGYRev0FileInfo.description: A description of the File which is sufficient to read file format for that exact file, e.g for segy , domain of data, (byte location of  pkey,skey,tkey,qkey, co-scale trace headers), endian, etc.  Note that a rich structure to handle all eventualities is out of scope for this version, so it remains to define a text based scheme that can handle common cases in the interim.  The property is explicitly named to limit the scope.

CoveragePercent.description: Actual nominal fold of the trace data set as processed, expressed as the mode in percentage points (60 fold = 6000%).

TextualFileHeader.description: Character metadata from headers inside file, such as the EBCDIC header of SEGY.  This is an array to capture each stanza separately.

RangeAmplitudeMax.description: The actual maximum amplitude value found in the dataset.

RangeAmplitudeMin.description: The actual minimum amplitude value found in the dataset.

StackAngleRangeMax.description: The stacking angle range maximum used during processing of this trace data set.

StackAngleRangeMin.description: The stacking angle range minimum used during processing of this trace data set.

StackAzimuthRangeMax.description: The stacking azimuth range maximum used during processing of this trace data set.

StackAzimuthRangeMin.description: The stacking azimuth range minimum used during processing of this trace data set.

StackOffsetRangeMax.description: The stacking offset range maximum used during processing of this trace data set.

StackOffsetRangeMin.description: The stacking offset range minimum used during processing of this trace data set.

SeismicWaveTypeID.description: The observed wave mode type in this trace data set (P, Sv, etc).
